This report shows the inbreeding coefficient of each animal, where pedigree data is available. The inbreeding coefficient is the kinship coefficient between the individual's parents. It measures the probability that the two alleles of a gene are identical by descent in the same individual (autozygosity). It is zero if the individual is not inbred.
This report shows information about the parentage of each animal, drawing from genetic data and observations
This report shows potential parents for the animal, which is based on housing at estimated time of conception

This report shows the kinship coefficient between every animal in the colony. The kinship coefficient is a measure of relatedness between two individuals. It represents the probability that two genes, sampled at random from each individual are identical (e.g. the kinship coefficient between a parent and an offspring is 0.25).
This report shows a calendar view of the mens observations entered by daily obs.
